website_summaries.verdict: A deluxe survival machete that boasts outstanding craftsmanship and can serve you well both now and in the future.
pros: Black powder-coated stainless steel blade delivers immense strength
Includes a ferro rod, sharpening stone and lanyard hole
Features a polyester sheath with removable shoulder pouch, shoulder strap, leg straps and belt loop, ensuring you'll have no trouble carrying the machete with you during outdoor adventures
cons: Tip may break after limited use
Powder-coated finish tends to wear down quickly

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use.
customer_reviews.text: I was a fan of the price, size, shape and sharpness. It cut through its own sheath during first use. It broke on second use with little effort against a hardwood. I may have gotten 4 hours out of this toy. Is there real machete brand that is similar that I can invest in that won't leave me blade-less deep in a Central American jungle? Please tell me. With great regret, I can't trust this one. I'd pay more for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Second one, broke in half!
customer_reviews.text: Was awesome for about 10 minutes of cutting 1/4 inch branches from a dead tree, then the blade bent and the black coating started to come off. Has a great feel in the hand and the weight is perfect. To bad it bent onn first use. Edit: 10/6/18 recived a new blade, used it 3 times and it broke in half and almost hit my leg! Dangerious product, do not buy. Totally want a refund on this horrable product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L.

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty metal
customer_reviews.text: Used this knife to cut coconuts, but also for cutting vines. I live in Hawaii and explore the jungle often. I whacked a tree limb and it broke the knife in half.. lame don't buy this knife if you want a heavy duty knife for jungle
customer_reviews.author: chantelle mashreghy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable until it fails
customer_reviews.text: The 1st time I actually put it to use it snapped in half. I did a bunch of smaller cuts and then was going to see how it did on a more heavy duty cut, I don't expect it to be an axe, but snapping in half after a few chops seems weak. It is very comfortable until it fails Update : May-15-2016, The blade was sent to Taylor Brands and a replacement was promptly sent back to me. Very helpful!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jay s kruger

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. In this case, a very convincing movie prop. Just don't try to actually USE it, or it will quickly become garbage. I wish I had known I was buying a toy before using it to cut weeds and vines. One use and the blade was TRASHED. (see photos) Otherwise, it looks great on film!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Vazquez II

customer_reviews.title: great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: comes with a decent edge, chops very well, scabard is awsome and comes with a diamond sharpener ferro rod, and is relitvly easy to sharpen. the only complant i have is at the bottom of the edge one side of the bevel goes down further than the other, but its not that noticble and can be easily fixed, but other than that its a very good quilty blade.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Wow, really impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Schrade product purchase and I have to admit I'm impressed. The product arrived very carefully packaged and wrapped very well. I was pleasantly surprised that it came with a fire started. The sheath it came in is a very well designed one with multiple carry options (shoulder strap, belt loop, etc), and looks and feels great. The blade itself is razor sharp and well designed. It is an amazing blade to own, and a very good buy for the price (price was significantly reduced on amazon by more than half). I have other good kukri's and this one doesn't fall short or disappoint at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Broke it the first time i used it to trim small branches
customer_reviews.author: Erica Devillier

customer_reviews.title: Bummed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband for Christmas a few years back. He was SO excited. He’s used it a handful of times, and it’s worked well...until he was chopping up some wood, and a ONE INCH CHUNK just chipped off the blade!! Very disappointed. It’s still useable, but a blade like this shouldn’t have a chunk come out from hacking at some wood.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been this excited and impressed in a long time. Very well made, very sharp and the edge of the blade is without blemish. I have small hands and this grip is wonderful. I like the weight of it, it feels good, not cumbersome. And the extras rock too! Very nice and well made sheath with multiple options for carry in different positions. The sharpening stone is good quality and I was even impressed with the fire starter because the piece of striking steel attached is heavy duty and well made. I didn't want to leave this very cool and functional outfit and slept with the it by my side for two days lol!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Spruce

customer_reviews.title: Great kukri but not the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I love shcrade edges. They tend to be razor sharp so this was a no brainer. The first use was razor sharp through bamboo but my next use in a forest seemed to require more effort. I found the blade had really been dulled from previous use. A sharpening fixed the issue but it did seem to lose the edge quicker than other shchrade products I've owned. Still a great hatchet replacement
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Munoz

customer_reviews.title: IMHO, good bang for the buck....
customer_reviews.text: Meanwhile, I’ve bought a second one. The first blade I received, needed a little honing of the blade, in order to make it as sharp as applicable to the use for this kind of blade. The second one, was sharp out of the box. The diamond sharpening tool that comes with the product is rather for honing, than repairing the edge of the blade. I haven’t used either blade yet. However, I trust the stainless steel utilized, will be working as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Neunerball

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! Comes very sharp, and the sheath is open on the bottom. I learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy solid well-built product. It comes very sharp. The sheath is sturdy however it's made out of canvas type material and it snaps together. That means the bottom has open spaces, and when you pull the knife out if you have your thumb on the bottom you might do yourself some damage. Seriously, be very careful! That being said, it's also a bad ass looking knife. Actually, more like a sword.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gaskil

customer_reviews.title: Not ridiculously sharp though you can put a better edge on it
customer_reviews.text: This machete surprised me with how well it splits and chops. Not ridiculously sharp though you can put a better edge on it. It comes with a diamond sharpening stone and ferro rod and the ferro rod is spectacular but the sharpening stone should probably just be used on knives. The handle is a really comfortable fit but a little big in the middle for people with small hands and it's very blade heavy. This machete won't break and the handle won't come loose or off, but the edge will roll or get a few tiny nicks in it over time. I've had it for over half a year now and it's the first consistently working blade/machete i've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth it, and Built to last.
customer_reviews.text: I got this item for my girlfriend because we decided to get some new blades. She picked this, I picked something else. Needless to say, I regret getting the item I chose and should have gotten one of these. This thing is super LEGIT! It feels great in my hand. And I love how it has the shoulder strap, belt strap and leg straps. Plus it comes with a sharpening stone and Ferro rod. 100% worth the money and definitely built to last. I'm buying one for myself the very second we have the extra cash.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davis

customer_reviews.title: to polish up the edge very nicely. It is definitely a tool to be very ...
customer_reviews.text: It's got more weight than the machetes from the farm stores. The blade needed sharpening, so I carefully used the diamond sharpener, included, to polish up the edge very nicely. It is definitely a tool to be very respected on the farm, hunting or fishing and camping. The grain on the edge is very fine and close together so it is good, hard steel. I tried it out on an oak stump that would dull a good chainsaw. The bark was easily busted off, for example if I needed a spark base, and I could easily chop off small bits of dry wood for tinder. My outdoorswoman friend also likes it and I'll be ordering another.
customer_reviews.author: RD Kepple

customer_reviews.title: It was awsome at first.
customer_reviews.text: It was awsome at first. Husband was using it on some wood for a fire and it broke at the handle no longer can use it
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: It’s a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to trim back a mesquite bush in my yard. Branches were no bigger than 2 inches. I started with another brand machete and it was getting dinged and bent. Switched to thing and it handled them like a beast. I had read some other reviews that warned about it breaking near the handle, I tell you, I had a few bad strikes and this thing kept going like a champ. Never used Schrade blades before, but I will definitely be looking at their products for future needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great... especially for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have abused it for about a year now in the woods and I know I will have it for many years. Hacks through some pretty tough stuff and keeps a good edge. I also like the little sharpener and the ferro rod that comes with it. I have sharpened many knives with the diamond stone and started a few camp fires with the ferro rod too. Great setup for a good price!!
customer_reviews.author: David W. Marshall Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great brush and tree clearer.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. To be honest I bought it because it looks cool. But the way it feels in your hand is incredible. The hand has a great feel that doesn't slide in your hand at all. The blade was razor sharp our of the box. Where this really shines is in chopping it's nicely balanced and I went through a 3" tree in six swings. I was blown away at how well this goes through trees and beaches. After about 20 minutes use I was done and the blade needed only minor touch up and it was razor sharp again. The sheath is very nicely made with multiple carry options.
customer_reviews.author: Caribulou

customer_reviews.title: Flawless.
customer_reviews.text: Schrades awesome. First off you get an AMAZING KUKRI. Second it comes with sharpener and fire starter that both work great. But now to go talk about the blade. Its thick nice weight to it its very durable chopped a bunch of stuff up! And the grips AMAZING. the blades sharp and really bites into wood but also cuts off branches and other things as well. There are alot of youtube reviews on it check em out. This thing is GREAT! And its only like 35 bucks. Cmon. Thats a 10/10 from me.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: A little on the weighty side but I can fell small trees with this thing with minimal effort. Do not try to use as you would a typical machete, for light brush requiring more of a whipping motion. This tool should be used for saplings, thick vines, and deeply rooted bushes. Comes with a sharpening tool and flint stick inside the case. Great tool, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Dont plan on using it to full capacity
customer_reviews.text: Have had this machete for 2 months. It was not used for any major chopping. Took it on vacation camping and it breaks while chopping small limbs (and by small I mean nor larger than 4" diameter).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Full Tang; Good Swinging Mass
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel. Definitely weighted enough for a desired swing to chop branches out of one away. Plan on taking this whenever I go camping or hiking into some new woods. Love the fact that it came with flint, magnesium and steel. I’m not sure how long the straps will last but it comes with two, one I assume is to be strapped to a persons thigh or maybe even their upper arm. Most definitely full tang.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: I own both sizes and am Very pleased with each
customer_reviews.text: I now own both the smaller and larger ones. They have a thick blade spine and are a very good handle. After using the smaller one to butcher smaller tree limbs and bushes I added the larger one for bigger tasks.
customer_reviews.author: babydawn01

customer_reviews.title: It looked good right out of the package and was very sharp
customer_reviews.text: It looked good right out of the package and was very sharp. Went to use it for the first time this weekend and the tip broke without force on the blade. I have bought many knives and machetes but this one by far has not been up to standards!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Tomas

customer_reviews.title: one of the best i'v used in a long time
customer_reviews.text: one of the best i'v used in a long time. dose what i needed it for and much more it is one of my better choices that I've made
customer_reviews.author: Charles K.

customer_reviews.title: I liked it up until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I liked it up until it broke. Used it for a solid day when I first got it a year ago, just took it out for some trail maintenance and snapped in half whacking a 2" thick branch.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Son-in-law gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son-in-law as a gardening tool. He has numerous ground cover vines that tend ot grow out over driveway, sidewalks, and grass. He says this is a great tool to cut back the vines. Easy handle and nice ballance.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Cool Travel

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! Right out of the box it will shave your arm. We took it out to see what it could handle and were blown away. Small branches no problem. Small trees no problem. Bamboo.....you guessed it no problem. The only thing we were able to roll the edge of the blade with was old dry bamboo but that was easily fixed with the supplied sharpener. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a good all around machete to either hack branches or zombies!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Quast

customer_reviews.title: Best machete I’ve got!
customer_reviews.text: The machete from Schrade is great I use it around the woods all the time. I’d suggest it to anyone else because you also get a blade sharpener, and a flint and steel rod. The machete just performes we’ll for the sort of chopping and things I need it for outside .Look into YouTube videos more about the machete to see how it kinda performs and anything else!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Dave

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a sturdy quality made product. Has some heft to it. Arrived sharp. I purchased this for the Zombie Apocalypse so I haven't actually used it yet but I feel confident that it wouldn't break if used roughly. 4 Stars
customer_reviews.author: We Review Products

customer_reviews.title: I took this on a recent camping trip and used ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a recent camping trip and used it to clear brush and chop small branches off of firewood. For the most part, it served that purpose very well. There was one branch I was trying to cut that was a little thicker, and I ended up with two small dents in the blade. I was hoping it'd be a stronger blade than that, and that it wouldn't dent, but overall it is still a high quality blade that I would definitely use again.
customer_reviews.author: Max C

customer_reviews.title: It will cut
customer_reviews.text: The blade feels good in the hand. The handle indexes well, and it has a 3 position grip that allows for different cutting/swing styles. It came very sharp, and I was impressed by how well it cut on the very first swing. All in all, it will cut.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Chop chop chop chop, pieces.....sharp right out of the box, even for the small area of sharpness, but that could be addressed, feels great in the hand. The weight towards the tip of the blade lends for easier chopping action. the handle feels like the Kukri will never leave your hand when you swing it. The packaging with the flint and sharpener are a nice addition with this package. The sheathe makes for easy deployment which is a plus and the strap systems allow for a great amount of carrying options. Really great product.
customer_reviews.author: JCazoe

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent buy. The blade is thick and full tang plus rubber grip makes it very sturdy/secure in the hand. I'm confident it can cleave off whatever I want. The sheath is much nicer than the cheap fabric that comes with others and looks sturdy enough to last EXCEPT the craftsmanship was a little shoddy on one of the snaps which I suspect will rip loose over use (hence the 4 stars). Still all very nice and amazing buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, front heavy, will require some getting used to for the inexperienced machete wielder
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice piece, great quality in blade metal and handle. Needs some sharpening. If you’re not used to a Kukri, this is a front heavy machete. It is harder to wield than a regular machete but if you get used to the weight and balance it is a highly effective tool.
customer_reviews.author: Denis Allman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I’m no jungle explorer so I had no real point of reference or expectations other than the blade would be sharp enough to cut some vines and small undergrowth of a lot I am clearing. For me, it was way better than I had hoped and I am totally satisfied...even impressed. It is comfortable in my hand, is heavy and sharp enough to cut through bigger trees that I had planned to cut with a small chainsaw. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: gary osborne

customer_reviews.title: best type I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality right out of the box, with this I was able to clear up the woods that has not been touched for 40 years, living and dead trees, weeds, branches. One swing will easily cut a living branch or vine etc up to 2 inches diameter, a bit of chop work for anything higher, the sharpner is not the best but gets the job done so I bought a diamond set, and that works awesome. Highly recommended for anyone needing to do yard work, extensive like I do, of all types of work really.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Merchand

customer_reviews.title: Strong basic knife
customer_reviews.text: A nice basic knife with a lot of chopping power behind the head. Good for dense brush, not so much for chopping large trees. A survival axes is better suited for that task. This product comes with a nice sling and a flint and steel for an added bonus. I'd recommend this as a starter machete for a backwoods enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade
customer_reviews.text: This blade is perfect for camping and just general use. I used it to trim up my rose bushes at the end of the season. I like the quality of this blade so much I am buying another Schrade knife and hatchet as a holiday gift to myself.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Langham

customer_reviews.title: Nice gurkha. Like it very much!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gurkha. We were chopping saplings with friends and it is as sharp as when I got it. Also the handle is quite nicely made. Like the full-tang design of the blade. Just make sure to be careful when you put it into the sheath, or when you take it out. That thing is very sharp and can easily hurt you quite badly. Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Can not hold up like an old $5 machete
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son because we wanted a high quality machete instead of the cheap old ones we have been using for years. I figured it would be worth the money. I was so wrong. The second time he used it, the blade snapped right off. So he used the old battered $5 machete to do the job this piece of junk could not. I am extremely dissatisfied, will not buy another Schrade product and warn my friends about it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb natola

customer_reviews.title: Quality Blade and Sheath
customer_reviews.text: This machete is well made. The handle is comfortable (rubber?) molded around the blade base, rather than have separate secured pieces that can fall apart. It has a sheath that is also well made, with snaps for securing it. It also has a sling and belt loop for carrying it around the waist or shoulder. These are secured by a Velcro strap to keep them out of the way if you don't need them. A small pocket with a sharpener is attached to the sheath.
customer_reviews.author: AncientOne

customer_reviews.title: Good blade dangerous and worthless sheath.
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what it is with blade makers anymore. They make a good blade and a garbage sheath. blade is solid and kukri style, its my second. But scabbard is two pieces riveted together, means its open between the rivet points so when you sheath it the cutting edge can stick out and slice you pretty good. Plus its kukri style not a straight sheath so your even more likely to have that happen.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Make
customer_reviews.text: Took it into the bush for a winter trip. Was gathering deadwood, trimming branches, and the blade broke over and over again after fifteen minutes of work.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great for clearing trails Update
customer_reviews.text: Great for clearing trails Update: broke in half cutting some 1" to 1 1/2" pine branches. Not so great anymore.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Bad ass!
customer_reviews.text: Bad ass!!!! came sharp and it is a beast. It landed a permanent spot in my survival bag. The shoulder sling is also the belt if worn on the waist. That is only complaint is I wish it had separate belt loop and maybe some molle straps. The diamond stone and fire starter are quality as well. I recommend this for a bug out, camping, brush clearing, survival and self defense.
customer_reviews.author: franklin hanson

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had not wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: The blade snapped in half while I was cutting a small root from the surface of the ground
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Machete
customer_reviews.text: This machete was a birthday gift for my son who picked it out. It is quite large and heavy due to the material it is made of. The holder for it is made of good quality nylon that should hold up to just about any wear and tear he may put it through. The machete will be added to my son's collection of knives and will be passed down to his son eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Julie McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Solid well balanced chopper at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Solid chopper. Cuts easy through branches and thick brush alike. Top heavy makes it easy to get good force into the strike with minimal swinging. Comfortable rubberized grip. Out of box I spent 30 minutes cutting and had no signs of damage or wear. Case is solid with options for belt, chest strap or thigh straps. For 35$ it seems like a great purchase. As with all tools, longevity will be the true test; I will update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Shopper

customer_reviews.title: machete
customer_reviews.text: This this is more a HUGE KNIFE THAN MACHETE ! I love it. I can cut up kill a boar, butcher him and slice for dinner all with this one blade ! I think if I go on Naked and Afraid this is coming too ! I always like Schrade's quality and this is no different. I would have paid this price for the knife alone but I also got the sheath, fire starter and sharpener ! AWESOME item - I would recommend to anyone !!
customer_reviews.author: Treycefus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, attractive, well packaged.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this for my older brother for his birthday. He loved it as well as my little brother. So I bought another one for little brother too. Two happy guys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a machete for firewood when camping. It's a great design for chopping, feels good. Nice shaped handle, if a little small for my big, un-Trump-like hands! Arrived very sharp and is holding up quite well. Mine came with a sharpening stone and a fire starter in the sheath. You really gotta be careful putting it back in...
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool/weapon. Takes a sharpening and holds an edge ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool/weapon. Takes a sharpening and holds an edge very well, hacks through trees no problem. I'm confident when the zombies attack that it will hack through them as well, but so far has just been used clearing brush and trimming limbs of trees. If it can lop through a two inch branch no problem, I'm confident it can lop through a zombie neck or arm as well.
customer_reviews.author: El Jefe

customer_reviews.title: Best machete on the market
customer_reviews.text: This kukri machete comes very sharp, it a great working machete and survival tool. Comes equipped with a fire starter kit, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Marquez

customer_reviews.title: A Solid, Sturdy Kukri!!
customer_reviews.text: This Kukri is solid!! It's hefty and will get razor sharp. I had mine sharpened by my knife maker who sharpens all my knives. He also put his "blessing" on this Kukri. He said he would use it as a survival knife himself. That means a lot coming from him. I feel that Shrade makes good production made blades. I recommend this Kukri and I'm pretty particular myself.
customer_reviews.author: CMaxDavis

customer_reviews.title: All around good
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have the typical cold steel kukri, and although that is a workhorse of a machete, this one is much nicer. It came out of the box ready to slice paper. I like the sheath design in the fact that you can throw it over your shoulder or strap it onto your leg. One thing I didn't notice was this came with a piece of flint (convenient, given I purchased at the same time a separate fire starter). Great feel, nice look, good weight, good sheath.
customer_reviews.author: sgbolt

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Longer Than My Sisters Interest In Wilderness Survival
customer_reviews.text: Not much else I can say. Sister binge watched Naked and Afraid... decided she'd be the next great survivalist. This outlasted all her learning attempts. Sure, she never did make me a bow from scratch that she promised... but that's hardly the machetes fault!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Shreve

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price and its super sharp
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price and its super sharp! I used it to trim a large bush in front of my house and it was a breeze. Sheath is good quality and lightweight. Perfect machete for someone who uses it lightly. I'll probably never use it to clear brush in woods so I have no idea how it would be in that situation but it cut through the branches of a treelike bush rather easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie S.

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse at a great value
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly my favorite thing I've ever gotten on Amazon. Its sturdy, comes with a shealth and stays sharper than I expected. And at a good price. I've had mine for a few years now, using for clearing brush, cutting/splitting wood mostly. I have come back and bought more as gifts for buddies. Just got my brother in law to be one for a wedding gift as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Mencia

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to my bushcraft. Made of good quality haven’t broke yet. Used it to clear up bushes and chop wood
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle ripped
customer_reviews.text: Nice machete, but the handle ripped on mine once I started using it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Someone used it to cut tree branches and bushes after a hurricane...They said it was good
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and weapon
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, and more. I use a machete in my yard work and also take it with me for both protection and for clearing brush/campfire wood. This Machete has good size and balance. It is razor sharp and comes with a very nice case (can be used on shoulder or waist) and even a striker plate and rod. In my opinion it was well worth the amount charged.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Astleford

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty chopper, batons well. The angle of ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty chopper, batons well. The angle of the blade and handle does the work for you. This machete would almost shave out of the box. It strikes a ferro rod very well once the coating is removed. The included sharpener and ferro rod work well. 5-Stars all the way. Well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Lee J.

customer_reviews.title: Far Cry
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome. Makes me feel like I'm in Far Cry. Sheath tore from inserting blade. Kinda my own fault, but really didn't expect it.
customer_reviews.author: L P

customer_reviews.title: Schrade Kukri
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in today. Has good weight and a comfortable swing. I did some light chopping in the woods. Razor sharp out of the box. After use, a few strokes through an Accusharp pocket sharpener and the edge was like new. Good Kukri machete for the price. I also have a Cold Steel KSMZ. Not as cool as the Schrade, but it works too.
customer_reviews.author: Blade Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Super strong!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machete. Took it to Hawaii with me on my camping trip and it was great for clearing branches and vines. Also used it to split wood for my campfire. VERY DURABLE! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kalanie Aholelei

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials at a GREAT PRICE!! I don't think you can find a better quality tool ANYWHERE , at this price point. It even comes with a quality sheath, multi mounting position straps , diamond sharpener and fire steel !! BUY ONE , you will not be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Croft Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great machete
customer_reviews.text: This beart ant machette ot bolo..its perfect. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cadeyrn

customer_reviews.title: Easily cut 1-2 in diameter trees with one swing and ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sharp out of the box bought it to clear some brush behind the house. Easily cut 1-2 in diameter trees with one swing and took down two large trees no problem. Plus it scares the neighbors
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't say it was razor sharp from the factory. Does what I need it for. Sheath works well and the the fire starter and the field sharpener is a nice touch. I did sharpen it to - don't rub your finger down the blade
customer_reviews.author: Squidward

customer_reviews.title: The handle is solid and materials seem to be holding up just fine. It's very sharp and meets all if my ...
customer_reviews.text: When I received this machete in the mail it was immediately clear that this was a well crafted knife. The handle is solid and materials seem to be holding up just fine. It's very sharp and meets all if my expectations. I would recommend this machete to anyone who wants a well crafted very sharp machete. We will see how the jungles of Indonesia hold up against this thing.
customer_reviews.author: christian larson

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Do not buy the Gerber. Damn thing would bend cutting 1/2" white pine. Schrade is a much better steel, holds an edge well and the sharpener works fine. I can work all day clearing my back woods. The kids and I really enjoyed the striker and learning how to start our bonfires. I will be buying more Schrade.
customer_reviews.author: SMB

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I personally believe that machetes are made for clearing brush from ones path, not splitting logs, but mine can, I love this thing! Even after splitting 5 logs it still held its edge, most impressed!! The price is perfect and the shipping was fast. DEF. A MUST BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice I'm Well Pleased
customer_reviews.text: It even comes pretty sharp right out of the box. Not razor sharp but plenty good enough to slice through paper.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Great machete!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machete! I’m a surveyor so I use machetes daily. This one came sharp holds its edge very well. I Like the sheath you can put it around your back or strap it to your leg. The size is nice because I can fit it in my Survey bag with my instrument when I don’t need it on my side. There hasn’t been anything this machete won’t cut through. Overall a great machete.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Riffle

customer_reviews.title: I love this machete
customer_reviews.text: I love this machete! For the price its fantastic and I have only had minor dings in the blade and that was from some serious usage.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it, quality is top shelf
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it, quality is top shelf. For this price I don't know how you would do better. Great weight and balance when swinging it and chops well. Plus you get a high quality nylon web sheath, a diamond sharpener and a flint with stricker.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Firmin

customer_reviews.title: Great pick up for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pick up for the price. Does get dull easy when hacking away at harder trees, but will clear small brush and take down trees that are less then 10 inches around with a couple of wacks, the softer the wood the faster the work. Come with a nice sheath, and firestarter and blade sharpener. I use the S&W PP1 pocket pal to sharpening it faster.
customer_reviews.author: Zenitram

customer_reviews.title: Very cool knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm not exactly sure why I bought this but it is very nice. I have used it to cut some brush along a path near my home and it has worked well. It is very strong and the bad has not chipped at all yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Schrade delivers a good machete here
customer_reviews.text: A full tang kukri-type machete with good balance and nice hand grip handle. Sheath is durable and easy to access. For camping or hiking in heavy vegetation. Feels good is use.
customer_reviews.author: G in SC

customer_reviews.title: Glad I did
customer_reviews.text: looked at a couple types of these before making the choice to buy this one. Glad I did. When I got this today and checked out the blade it was perfect. have not had the chance to try this on anything yet, no zombies, to cold for them to move. Sharp enough for the job. Can not wait for summer to try it out. Glad I bought this one. You will to
customer_reviews.author: doodle

customer_reviews.title: Solid and durable
customer_reviews.text: Solid and durable with decent sharpening stone and fire starter. Love it. Be wary of fingers when sheathing and un-sheathing.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool to use in the rainforest
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this ,for my trip to the Peruvian Amazon ..Excellent tool to use in the rainforest ! Very sharp ! ..cut Stingray barb like butter !
customer_reviews.author: Bela Kalman

customer_reviews.title: ... for 3years clearing brush and trees for work very happy with this product the sharping tool suck but I ...
customer_reviews.text: been using this product for 3years clearing brush and trees for work very happy with this product the sharping tool suck but I use a hand file instead would recommend wrapping the handle with paracord for extra grip but overall the product is awesome and very handy
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cross

customer_reviews.title: Wonder Blade
customer_reviews.text: This by far the best machete I've ever purchased. It was also the least expensive. It's incredibly durable and came with its own sharpener and a fire starter. This is a must have for any camper or trail blazer. The blade came presharpened which is becoming less common and it held its edge for a remarkably long time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like how they sewed the sheath so it won't cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Came as advertised, sharp and strong. Like how they sewed the sheath so it won't cut you while holstered. Haven't given it too much abuse, but have hacked away at 1/4 inch branches and vines. No problems so far and has a nice weight.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V

customer_reviews.title: Super fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Super fast shipping! Machete is awesome!!! All of my previous experience has been with ones from home improvement stores or harbor freight. Those are toys compared to this. I easily cut my way through the woods. I even cut through trees a couple of inches in diameter and palm trees. I would highly recommend this machete!!
customer_reviews.author: bsr4397

customer_reviews.title: Its alright
customer_reviews.text: 4 Stars because of the handle and the metal slip guard. The handle is a hard material and when wet really slippery, also the metal slip guard is really uncomfortable, and when chopping a lot can and will cause a blister. Other than that a really good chopper, the sheath is decent, I really liked the fire steel that came with it, the sharpener is crap might as well toss it if you know alternative way to sharpen.
customer_reviews.author: victor Ivanov

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Good grip, relatively sharp, and comes with a diamond sharpener! Awesome design as well.
customer_reviews.author: THATGUYMANN

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Full Tang Machete
customer_reviews.text: Nice hefty blade for chopping brush, sharp as a razor and fun to carry with a body strap for adventures in the woods or for the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Zipple

customer_reviews.title: His blade chipped off right at the tip while cutting through standard foliage indicating poor workmanship. Unable to contact seller for refund or ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, the second one for my son. His blade chipped off right at the tip while cutting through standard foliage indicating poor workmanship. Unable to contact seller for refund or replacement. Super disappointed in this item. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the tards, the sheath is fine.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used, the thing feels great though. I give it five stars because of the idiots on here who say the sheath is bad. There is a LITTLE BUTTON CATCH that you are supposed to release and pull the blade out at an angle. To any numbskull on here who thought that they were supposed to pull a 3" wide blade through a 1.5" gap, I say to you sir/mam that you deserve to cut yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It is so much better in person has a good weight to it and its great for vines when I go on Hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Jared shaw

customer_reviews.title: Love this machete!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. it's got a great feel/weight and chops through about anything almost effortlessly. like with all machetes, use gloves if you'll be chopping with it for extended periods of time to avoid blisters. the handle is grippy, but that will lead to blisters without gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy as can be great build quality works very well as a machete but it's so heavy it can almost take the place of a hatchet so points for dual-use this is the one to get though it's a smaller cousin is virtually useless oh and the edge retention is very good
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat it. Finish and sharpness very good.Very sturdy blade. Easily lop off 1"+ diameter limbs with one swing. I used it non stop for two hours to clear low hanging limbs, brush and saw briars and to my surprise the blade seemed just as sharp when I finished as it was before I started. Handles very nicely, Sheath also very good.
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Great machete
customer_reviews.text: Use for clearing some brush on my property. Blade held up well when cutting through some very thick trees. Didn't even need to be sharpened when I was done, the edge stayed very sharp and free of dings.
customer_reviews.author: Ponster1

product_meta.title: Schrade SCHKM1 19.7in Kukri Machete with 13.3in Stainless Steel Blade and Safe-T-Grip Handle for Outdoor Survival, Camping and Bushcraft
product_meta.description: Schrade takes pride in creating trustworthy knives that are perfect for all outdoor adventures. Whether you are hiking, camping, executing bushcraft or any in other activities, Schrade is the strong performing companion you need.
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: 19.7 inch (50 cm) overall length with a blade length of 13.3 inches (33.8 cm) and a weight of 1 lb 6.6 ounces
DURABLE: Blade is made of reliable 3Cr13 Powder Coated S.S. with a black safety grip handle
DEPENDABLE: Quick and easy access with the convenient polyester sheath with a removable shoulder pouch, shoulder strap, leg strap and belt loop making it the ideal cutting tool
SECURE: Have confidence that the blade will not slip with the security of the front quillon
BE PREPARED: Machete features a ferro rod, sharpening stone and a lanyard hole
